channel.title: Technology : NPR
channel.description: Latest technology news and breakthroughs in technology, science, and industry. Download the NPR Technology podcast and Technology RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Yes, 'World's Largest Nerf Gun' Is An Actual World Record. This Engineer Made It
item.description: January 22, 2017 • Mark Rober designed a huge Nerf gun to win an office Nerf war. He talks to NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro about how he designed it, and what happens when you get hit with a pool noodle at 40 mph. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/22/511048797/yes-worlds-largest-nerf-gun-is-an-actual-world-record-this-engineer-made-it

item.title: Survey Finds Lyft Drivers Happier Than Uber, Though Pay Has Declined
item.description: January 21, 2017 • A survey of 1,150 drivers found that those working for Lyft made more on average than those at Uber. It also illustrates demographics of participants in the ride-hailing industry. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/01/21/510479642/survey-finds-lyft-drivers-happier-than-uber-though-pay-has-declined

item.title: Digital Transition Of Power Is Not So Peaceful
item.description: January 20, 2017 • As with every new administration, Donald Trump and his team took over the White House website Friday. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/20/510847064/digital-transition-of-power-is-not-so-peaceful

item.title: On The Day Of White House Transitions, Twitter Shifts @POTUS To Donald Trump
item.description: January 20, 2017 • Twitter will automatically switch 13 million @POTUS followers to follow both the new Trump account and Barack Obama's archived @POTUS44 account. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/01/20/510784802/on-the-day-of-white-house-transitions-twitter-shifts-potus-to-donald-trump

item.title: Tristram Wyatt: How Do Pheromones Really Work?
item.description: January 19, 2017 • Pheromones are mysterious compounds that can make a mammal smell more sexy--but that's not true for humans. Zoologist Tristram Wyatt says human pheremones are hard to find. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/20/510625135/how-do-pheromones-really-work

item.title: Expletive-Laden Speech By Steelers' Coach Streamed On Facebook Live
item.description: January 17, 2017 • Pittsburgh head coach Mike Tomlin warned his players to keep a low profile on social media in the run-up to Sunday's playoff game. Antonio Brown surreptitiously streamed the speech on Facebook Live. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/17/510204514/expletive-laden-speech-by-steelers-coach-streamed-on-facebook-live

item.title: Takeaways From The Day Dyn Was Attacked And We Couldn't Tweet
item.description: January 16, 2017 • Last October, a cyber attack made it hard for people to access Twitter, Netflix, Spotify and other popular sites. Here's what we learned from that massive "distributed denial of service," attack. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/16/510128857/takeaways-from-the-day-dyn-was-attacked-and-we-couldnt-tweet

item.title: 'Robot Lawyer' Makes The Case Against Parking Tickets
item.description: January 16, 2017 • The online service DoNotPay has helped motorists in London, New York City and Seattle overturn more than 200,000 parking tickets, the creator says. Now, the service is expanding across the U.S. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/16/510096767/robot-lawyer-makes-the-case-against-parking-tickets

item.title: Spider Silk Is Stronger Than Steel — And Now It Can Be Made In A Lab
item.description: January 14, 2017 • Swedish scientist Dr. Anna Rising was among a team of researchers to discover how to synthesize artificial spider silk. She says they hope to use the strong silk in medical applications and textiles. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/14/509807212/spider-silk-is-stronger-than-steel-and-now-it-can-be-made-in-a-lab

item.title: Takata To Pay $1 Billion Over Air Bag Fraud; 3 Executives Criminally Charged
item.description: January 13, 2017 • The settlement with the Justice Department is tied to a deadly defect in air bags that has been linked to at least 16 deaths. The associated recall is the largest in U.S. auto safety history. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/01/13/509665912/takata-to-pay-1-billion-over-airbag-fraud-3-executives-criminally-charged

item.title: Avi Rubin: What Happens When Hackers Hijack Our Smart Devices?
item.description: January 13, 2017 • Computer scientist Avi Rubin says all our smart devices — cars, phones, even fitness trackers — can be hacked. He warns that our network of connected technology puts us at risk for cyberattacks. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/13/509355546/what-happens-when-hackers-hijack-our-smart-devices

item.title: Wanis Kabbaj: Can We Improve Our Transportation Network Using...Biology?
item.description: January 13, 2017 • Wanis Kabbaj wants traffic to flow smoothly and efficiently, like the blood in our veins. He says driverless cars may be the solution to today's highway gridlock. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/13/509353176/can-we-improve-our-transportation-network-using-biology

item.title: EPA Accuses Fiat Chrysler Of Installing Emissions-Cheating Software
item.description: January 12, 2017 • The Environmental Protection Agency says Fiat Chrysler violated the Clean Air Act by allegedly installing software in about 104,000 vehicles that masked the true level of emissions. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/01/12/509493597/epa-accuses-fiat-chrysler-of-installing-emissions-cheating-software

item.title: Rudy Giuliani To Advise Trump On Cyber Issues
item.description: January 12, 2017 • The president-elect plans to issue a report in 90 days on how the government can improve cyber security. http://www.npr.org/2017/01/12/509485046/rudy-giuliani-to-advise-trump-on-cyber-issues

item.title: In Social Media Age, Young Cops Get Trained For Real-Life Conversation
item.description: January 12, 2017 • Some police officials say their millennial-aged recruits are so used to communicating using social media that they need training in talking with people face to face. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/01/12/509444309/in-social-media-age-young-cops-get-trained-for-real-life-conversation
